intro: Pedicularis gyroflexa subsp. cenisia, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high elevations. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, are adapted for pollination by insects such as bees and flies. The subspecies cenisia is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and specific floral morphology compared to other subspecies of Pedicularis.
